subject: Technology
title: The Psychological Challenge of Isolation
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Psychological Challenge of Isolation usable.

hook.text: You live in a tin can with five coworkers for six months. You cannot go outside, call a friend, or take a walk.

buildup.text: Astronauts on the ISS experience isolation, confinement, and a 45-minute sunrise-sunset cycle.

discovery.text: NASA studies how crews handle conflict, loneliness, and sleep disruption in these extreme conditions.

twist.text: Some astronauts report a profound shift called the 'overview effect': seeing Earth from space changes their worldview forever.

climax.text: A Mars mission would mean years of isolation with no real-time communication. The psychology may be harder than the engineering.

punchline.text: Getting to Mars is an engineering problem. Surviving it is a human one.

quiz.question: What is the 'overview effect'?
options: A profound shift in worldview from seeing Earth from space
A visual distortion caused by zero gravity
